task: Fix PowerShell syntax error in Ollama integration test script

error_analysis.error_message: Variable reference is not valid. ':' was not followed by a valid variable name character
error_analysis.root_cause: PowerShell parser interpreting '$category:' as drive reference instead of variable

fix_applied.solution: Used ${} delimited variable reference to avoid drive syntax conflict
fix_applied.verification: PowerShell parser now correctly interprets variable reference

week1_day3_hour1_2_implementation_status.module_manifest: Complete .psd1 with proper exports and metadata
week1_day3_hour1_2_implementation_status.test_script: Created and syntax error fixed - ready for execution
week1_day3_hour1_2_implementation_status.deliverables: All Week 1 Day 3 Hour 1-2 deliverables completed

syntax_fix_details.issue: PowerShell variable expansion in string context with colon separator
syntax_fix_details.conflict: Parser mistakenly interprets $variable: as drive reference syntax
syntax_fix_details.solution: Use ${variable} delimited syntax to explicitly define variable boundary
syntax_fix_details.pattern: Replace $var: with ${var}: in string interpolation contexts
syntax_fix_details.prevention: Always use ${} delimited variables when followed by special characters

testing_readiness.syntax_validated: ParseException resolved with proper variable delimitation
testing_readiness.test_framework: Comprehensive test categories for full validation
testing_readiness.success_criteria: Week 1 Day 3 Hour 1-2 deliverable validation ready
testing_readiness.integration_ready: Compatible with existing AutoGen and documentation systems

next_steps.next_phase: Proceed to Week 1 Day 3 Hour 3-4 if validation successful
